revised_title: Viability of Cartilage Cells and Tissues after Freezing: A Discussion
tldr: This article discusses the viability of cartilage cells and tissues after freezing, focusing on the potential use of cartilage homografts in humans. The authors explore different methods of preserving cartilage, such as pretreatment with glycerol and slow cooling, and seek advice on improving the survival of cartilage cells during the freezing process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology and Tissue Engineering
